Shelp.shelp:name: createCellFormat
Shelp.shelp:title: Create virtual cell format information.
Shelp.shelp:description:
This is intended to create an object similar to that returned from getCellFormat to represent format information for a Gnumeric cell.
This is not intended for use quite yet. Instead, one can retrieve the format settings of a cell using getCellFormat and then modify the resulting object. Also, one can retrieve and set the format specifications from a cell using the $.GnumericCellRef operators. The latter is the more "tested" way to do this.

shelp:argument.shelp:argDescription: a collection of name-value pairs which are collected into the new object to define its contents.

an existing format object whose values are to be taken as defaults if no corresponding attribute is specified in the
argument.
a logical value indicating whether the names of the elements in the are to be checked against the known names of supported attributes.

Shelp.shelp:details: This is implemented entirely within S. One should use getCellFormat instead to get the structure from the C code and Gnumeric directly.
Shelp.shelp:value: A list containing the elements in and those in , if specified.
Shelp.shelp:note: The interface is highly experimental. The basic mechanism is reasonably solid.
